articles.title: Elon Musk drops heart emoji after Donald Trump sends surprising ‘I wish him well’ message
articles.description: Donald Trump and Elon Musk may be ending their feud, as Trump publicly wished Musk well and Musk responded with a heart emoji on X. Their clash had escalated over Trump’s tax bill and Musk’s harsh criticism.
articles.content:
In a surprising turn, former allies Donald Trump and Elon Musk appear to be stepping back from a highly publicised feud that has dominated headlines in recent week.
Asked if he planned to speak to Musk, Trump responded: “I haven’t really thought abou... [1970 chars]

articles.title: England 1-3 Senegal: Thomas Tuchel's team suffer historic defeat in Nottingham to add to Andorra struggles
articles.description: Match report as England suffer historic defeat to Senegal, beaten 3-1 at the City Ground despite opening the scoring through Harry Kane; result increases pressure on Thomas Tuchel after underwhelming performance against Andorra on Saturday
articles.content:
England succumbed to their first defeat to African opposition as they were beaten 3-1 by Senegal in an international friendly at the City Ground.
Thomas Tuchel had been looking for a response following England's uninspired 1-0 win over Andorra on Sat... [6192 chars]

articles.title: At least 36 Palestinians killed in shooting near Gaza aid site, health ministry says
articles.description: At least 36 Palestinians were killed while attempting to get aid in southern Gaza on Tuesday, according to the Hamas-run Gaza Ministry of Health.
articles.content:
At least 163 people have been killed while trying to get aid from the GHF.
At least 36 Palestinians killed in shooting near Gaza aid site, health ministry says

articles.title: 'Astounding' land sales at Queanbeyan-Palerang Council auction to recoup unpaid rates
articles.description: It was meant to be a run-of-the-mill auction with only one interested party, but then locals say nefarious actors turned up and prices soared.
articles.content:
A forest farmer in rural New South Wales has paid $19,000 at auction to buy a tiny slice of his driveway that he always thought he owned, but actually belonged to a man who died 65 years ago.

articles.title: 'City killer' asteroid, headed earlier for Earth, now set to hit moon in 2032? NASA's latest update
articles.description: Experts at NASA's Center for Near Earth Object Studies have updated the 2024 YR4’s chance of hitting the Moon in 2032 to 4.3 per cent
articles.content:
Asteroid 2024 YR4, which was earlier seen as a threat to Earth, now appears to be on a collision course with the moon. Asteroid 2024 YR4 is on a collision course with the moon(Unsplash)

articles.title: Habagat to bring rain over most of PH; tropical cyclone remains outside PAR, PAGASA says
articles.description: The southwest monsoon or Habagat will bring cloudy skies with rain showers over Central and Southern Luzon, Visayas, and Mindanao on Wednesday, PAGASA reported.
articles.content:

articles.title: New rental rules: 45% of tenancies are with 'small landlords'
articles.description: A small landlord can end tenancies via a ‘no-fault eviction’ in limited circumstances, such as economic hardship or to move a family member in.
articles.content:
Approximately 45 per cent of renters are in a tenancy arrangement with what the Government deems to be a “small landlord”.
Rental reforms announced by Minister James Browne on Tuesday draw a distinction between “large” and “small” landlords.
